"One of the most refreshing parts of teaching Career & Technical Education at DHS is how the teachers in our department are always on the trek to learning more. Yesterday during our 1/2 Day Inservice, Jedd Swisher and Clyde Bradford joined us from Depke Welding and they provided some training on our new ArcLIGHT CNC Plasma table. Pictured here is some of the computer training along with the time spent in the recently improved Industrial Tech Welding area. It will not be long until you start seeing students using the graphic design skills learned in computer courses to create finished products using 21st Century Prototyping and Manufacturing tools largely thanks to our local partnerships with members of Vermilion Advantage as well as D118 Grants and the Vermilion Vocational Education Delivery Service (VVEDS)."

Shared by:
Daniel Hile

Congratulations to the DHS Scholastic Bowl team who earned second place in the Big 12 Conference Tournament last Friday night. DHS Quizzers took the Championship Round to the final question before falling to the Champaign Central Maroons in a close match 245-230. Sophomore Ezra Carter & Caleb Campbell earned All Tournament Honors scoring 4th and 5th respectively in toss-up questions answered. Also scoring well for the Vikings were Emma Hambley (SR), Christopher Morse (SR), Warren Slevar (SO), and KJ Woods (FR). Well done Scholastic Bowl!

Shared by:
Daniel Hile
Department Chair - Career and Technical Education
